result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

charges.descr: Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal)

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Matthew A Reynolds

records.addlTxt:
9:07 AM Attorney Daniel Joseph Tombasco in court for State of Wisconsin. Defendant Matthew A Reynolds in court. Clerk N. Nobile.
MINUTES: DE does not have his license today. ADA Tombasco advises the Court that he spoke with the DE before court and the DE has his assessment at Hope Council scheduled for November. DE should be able to obtain his license around the end of December. Court will adjourn hearing.
Final pre-trial scheduled for January 6, 2023 at 10:00 am.

Minutes:  9:40am.  Clerk/T. Lema.  ADA Daniel Tombasco appeared for the State.  Deft appeared in person pro se.  Deft needs add'l time to obtain his DL.  No objection by the State.  Plea hrg set for 10/14/22 @ 9am.
No disposition. Leave on for next scheduled court activity.

ADDRESS INFO for Matthew A Reynolds
Current: 1914 25Th Street, **LKA - MAIL RTND 05/27/22**, Kenosha, WI 53140   (Effective: 04-20-2022)
Prior: 1914 25Th Street, Kenosha, WI 53140
Return to sender.  Not deliverable as addressed.  Unable to forward.  Notice of Hearing returned.

ADDRESS INFO for Matthew A Reynolds
Current: 4711 20th Avenue, Kenosha, WI 53140 United States  (Effective: 05-26-2022)
Prior: 1914 25Th Street, Kenosha, WI 53140

PROPER ATTIRE REQUIRED.  NO SHORTS OR TANK TOPS ALLOWED IN COURTROOM.
Continued Posted.
  *Not to drive w/o VALID Driver's License.  *TO SUBMIT TO BOOKING AND PROCESSING BY 4:00PM TODAY.

146PM    Assistant District Attorney Brenda Valdes appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in court in person.   Clerk JT  Minutes:  The Court finds probable cause in this case today.    Def. is referred to the Public Defender.  If not eligible, def. to retain his own counsel. Court date will not be adjourned due to def.'s failure to retain counsel.  Plea of Not Guilty entered by the court. Pre-trial conference scheduled for July 8, 2022 at 01:15 pm.  Judicial Pretrial - in court scheduled for August 10, 2022 at 09:30 am. $500   Cash Bond continued posted w/conditions (see bond entry). DE must be booked today. rb
Return on warrant/Initial appearance on May 26, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
bond posted in Racine Co and court date given
